website_summaries.verdict: The Moto G5 Plus sets a new standard for affordable unlocked phones with a premium build, solid specs, smooth performance, and bloatware-free Android software.
pros: Compatible with all major US carriers

customer_reviews.title: Having used it for over a year now she has found it excellent for her needs as it is big
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an elderly relative because of the screen size. Having used it for over a year now she has found it excellent for her needs as it is big, responsive and the interface is straightforward. The phone itself shows great performance and the specs are fantastic for the price. Can't go wrong with this if you want a functional and powerful handset with all the things you'd expect and require of a phone!
customer_reviews.author: ACM

customer_reviews.title: Really smart looking and easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Really smart looking and easy to operate. Note that it does take the mini sim so you may need to change your card with your provider if you're keeping your data and number. This was done reasonably quickly and easily. Lovely clear screen. Battery seems to be lasting much longer than my previous phones given the same usage - great! Great value for money. Instructions did come in Italian! Not a problem though as you can download a comprehensive handbook and once into the phone it has a built in guide and troubleshooting guide.
customer_reviews.author: Simone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent For The Basics
customer_reviews.text: I'm not interested in all the latest bells and whistles. I want a phone that will make calls, send texts, let me access the odd news/sports app, do some casual browsing while my superior half haunts shops, take the occasional photo that's not necessarily a keeper (I have a proper camera for that) and maybe listening to the odd audio book if I ever get around to "lifting my fat ass off the sofa." As a result, I only have to charge my G5 every two days so that's one less reason to get off said sofa. Win win. Yeay me.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Very good phone for the money - great features like twisting ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good phone for the money - great features like twisting and chopping for camera and torch, re-wiring the fingerprint sensor to open the app drawer and back buttons so you gain a bit more screen space. I kept finding the WiFi dropping our though, and from other online reviews I see the chip set isn't the fastest- there's plenty of slow-down of animations in and out of apps. Motorola's lack of updates to patch the Bluetooth exploit that others updated over the summer is also a worry.
customer_reviews.author: Caol Frazer

customer_reviews.title: Wow..
customer_reviews.text: Wow.. Just wow.. The "G5S" though.. Exceeded my expectations.. I'd previously bought an Xperia XA1, but was disappointed.. Bought this instaed, and was blown away.. Lovely screen.. For a TFT, IMO, as good as AMOLED Sound: Nice and loud Body: beautifully crafted.. Though btns are plastic.. UX/UI: Nice basic Android non bloated setup.. easy to use. Camera: Pretty good.. Good in low light.. With adjustments to exposure.. shutter speed a little slow.. Definitely worth the money.. A little more expensive than things like the Xperia XA1.. But leagues better..
customer_reviews.author: Gio

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! I moved from an Elephone P8000 to this
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I moved from an Elephone P8000 to this, initially having chosen a Wiley Fox Swift 2 plus which is on its way back due to a screen/software fault that meant the touchscreen stopped responding every so often. The G5S is obviously more expensive but unlike the swift I haven't once thought I wish I hadn't bought this or this doesn't seem right, in fact I keep thinking what a great phone the G5S is.
customer_reviews.author: R. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Pros Lovely design and very hardy Decent camera Picks up a reception in places my last phone couldn't Decent call quality Very easy to use and (at present) extremely fast/smooth Fingerprint sensor ...
customer_reviews.text: Only had for a week but really enjoying this phone. Pros Lovely design and very hardy Decent camera Picks up a reception in places my last phone couldn't Decent call quality Very easy to use and (at present) extremely fast/smooth Fingerprint sensor reacts well Cons Not much choice of covers/screen protectors as still quite new (don't buy tempered glass covers as the screen is ever so slightly curved and they wont stick) No USB-C charger All in all a great budget phone!!
customer_reviews.author: Amarendra Singh

customer_reviews.title: I needed a phone ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this, it's great and I've already dropped it from about 3m ... bounced and was fine (I added rubber cover to it) I needed a phone ... just a phone. Usual stuff, text, email, odd photo of something, apps for nav, and work stuff. Calendar, alarm, reminders .. sometimes listening to music. Can someone explain why I need a £1000 phone? I will genuinely buy you an iPhone X if you can come up with one single valid reason I need to spend £1000 on a phone ...
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: almost-vanilla Android, great performance for casual use
customer_reviews.text: Works better than my previous £350 phone. It has almost-vanilla Android, and you can see it in its performance, and the Motorola gestures are a nice touch (you can turn on the torch and take photos by moving the phone in certain ways, very fast and convenient) as well as the fingerprint reader. If you want a nice all-rounder for WhatsApp, Google Maps, emails, text and calls, and moderate internet use, you cannot do any better. Anyway, mind that it is a £150ish phone, so please don't expect a flagship (iPhone 8 or Galaxy S8), but it is very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Isern

customer_reviews.title: Glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.text: Had this awhile now and bit is an excellent phone. Charges very fast, and does what I want. The only thing is a lack of zoom on the excellent camera, but I might have just missed that. The battery being replaceable was a big plus in my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Really good value. I bought this after my Sony phone ( which was very expensive) decided to stop working properly. Sony refused to help. I am very happy with everything on this phone. The only drawback is that getting emails through a personal domain is difficult. I now feed mine through Gmail. I still have this full stars as it is such good value and so easy to use with a great camera which I use for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A no brainer - better than phones that cost twice as much.
customer_reviews.text: Why bother with an I phone or a Samsung when this puppy does pretty much everything you want at a fraction of the price. Runs the most up to date version of Android, all the apps. The Camera is great and the screen bright with good resolution I was a Samsung customer before I brought this and I'm now converted. I have a Lenovo (same company) tablet as well and its brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Amadeus

customer_reviews.title: No brainer
customer_reviews.text: I have had both of the big brand expensive phones. This is every bit as good at a fraction of the price. Plenty of storage and very fast. These "mid level" brands are making some really good phones with specs to match the top brands. You don't get the iPhone name but you get everything else for £175 instead of close to £1000. No brainer
customer_reviews.author: Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish.... will never buy another Motorola.. zero star
customer_reviews.text: Not had phone two months, I'm retired and the phone has occasional use, mainly sits on a table. On cleaning the screen with the supplied duster the screen literally cracked from top to bottom in half, the two sides completely parting company. Phone was never damaged or injured, just really really poor quality. Motorola really unhelpful and the cost to replace the glass is the same as the phone cost. Very disappointed and will never again own a Motorola, had Samsung for years and much better quality phones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sceptical because of price but its a brilliant phone. its fast
customer_reviews.text: bought for wife . sceptical because of price but its a brilliant phone . its fast . great screen . camera is excellent . feels and looks like quality . compared camera shots with son and daughters samsung phones all agreed moto as good if not better . so rest of family have bought the next model up g5s+ . exellent
customer_reviews.author: kevin davies

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is for the Amazon 3GB model. Really excellent phone. Been using it completely problem free for a year. Lots of heavy use, battery life is still good. Haven't bothered with intensive games much as i game elsewhere; Hitman ran fine. Picture quality is very nice. Sound is nothing special, although acceptable. Camera quality is good. Only minor negatives are: the battery never seemed to charge to 100%, taking soooo long in the 90's I that it wasn't worth carrying on, although the update to Android 8.1 seems to have improved thi; and the fingerprint reader is weirdly hit and miss when unlocking the phone, but far more competent in-app. Overall, brilliant phone, and I'm likely to buy Moto again.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: This is my first mobile phone with a touch screen ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mobile phone with a touch screen so I am only just getting used to it. I think my fingers must be rather large as I am pressing the wrong keys quite a lot of the time. I have used a USB OTG Adapter to attach a mouse to the phone to make sure I enter passwords correctly.Well perhaps my hands are a little shaky as you might expect for an 81 year old! I hope to review this again when I'm 90 and I am more familiar with the phone hopefully!
customer_reviews.author: Roland Booth

customer_reviews.title: So far impressed, well done MOTO
customer_reviews.text: Had it for some time now, so far so good, it is inexpensive, takes 2 SIMS. GOOD: 1 much faster then the old 2gb RAM mobile. 2.No issues with gps, wifi or bluetooth 3. The battery lasts 1.5-2 days. 4. The camera is decent. 5. Fingerprint unlocks the phone fast if it works(see below) BAD: 1. Fingerprint sensor can sometimes not recognize your finger from the first try (1 out of 5-6 times) 2. shutdown and reset itself once in 2 months during using Nokia Maps SatNav in the car. Was in a new area and in a rush, bad timing MOTO))
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Superb.
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't realised just how much had advanced and improved since my MOTO G Mk.1 days., when bought as gift for my wife. A delight to use. Just remember, ladies, MAY need a new handbag with larger phone pocket, for it's size. ~sighs~ Now I have to add handbags to my wife's Xmas list.
customer_reviews.author: Tony-Bins

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY  is really removable
customer_reviews.text: Good price,fast delivery. This is a genuine UK usable phone.Good specs too.The battery lasts ages.Too many other sites are offering phones not designed for use in UK and without adequate support.The battery is also removable.No tools needed.What is the point of a mobile phone with a non removable battery.Who would buy a lap top without a removable battery.How do you re boot effectively?
customer_reviews.author: Commissioner Sanders

customer_reviews.title: It's a phone (and a computer and a camera) and it works well.
customer_reviews.text: It's not an iPhone, there I've said it. However, it is an excellent phone for making and receiving voice calls (remember them?) all over the world. It's also got plenty of storage and enough RAM and processing power to run apps quickly enough. The screen is good and plenty large enough, the camera is good and the wi-fi connection just works. And battery life is easily enough for a day.
customer_reviews.author: A. Preston

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, bought this for my mother and she loves it. Really easy phone to use as it is pretty much stock android. Camera is great on it for the price range. Call quality, 4g/3g signal is perfect. She gets well over a day on the battery, mainly used for browsing social media, taking snaps and calls. To date no faults with it, stuck in an SD card so no issue with memory. Phone came fully sealed and all in perfect order with very quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good value phone
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly fine for the price. In fact brilliant when I think about it. Phone calls are nice and clear (why do magazine reviewers never cover that?). Plenty of space for apps and tunes. And everything opens and closes smoothly enough. Nice size too. My only gripe was the courier, who thoughtlessly left it out in the rain when delivering, but Amazon resolved that and compensated me for it.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: This my third MotoG - the 1 was great, the three was great apart from it had ...
customer_reviews.text: This my third MotoG - the 1 was great, the three was great apart from it had a way too sensitive a screen, even set at lowest, the 5 seemed great but the screen has cracked with just a small fall. Interestingly they all fail after two years, but that's the same with anything these days unfortunately - slaves to the system
customer_reviews.author: Marmot

customer_reviews.title: Wipes itself! Automatically resets to factory settings
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone in March, less than five months later it started turning itself off. Today while using youtube it turned itself off and reset to factory settings, wiping everything. Absolutely no idea how or why. It is a dodgy phone at best. And now I can't find any support at all as to why this has happened or how to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant Phone for the money. I bought this to replace a MotoG4 which I also liked. If you are looking for a phone to do work / day to day things well and not just some status symbol bling brick then this is for you. This phone does everything really well, the screen is clear and responsive, its Dual sim so allows 2 sims to operate at the same time. I especially like the shake to turn on the torch and wobble to turn on the camera.. really handy . For the price there really isnt anything out there to beat it..
customer_reviews.author: Wile_E_Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Great phone great price.
customer_reviews.text: Moto g5s. Great phone, great price. I've been using this phone for about a month now & I am very pleased with it's performance & features. Coming from a nexus 4 (which was a great little phone), this is a massive step up! Performance is fast & smooth (with no glitches or stutters), the display is superb with great viewing angles, the sound is great (rich, clear & surprisingly loud) & the photos/videos are excellent. I would highly recommend this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr J L Porter

customer_reviews.title: Not great product quality
customer_reviews.text: Its OK for the price - since it is not priced like the crazy £500+ phones, but after 6 months the battery died and had to get another new one. The phone also has a habit of rebooting itself about once a week which is very worrying. This has been the case since I bought it. Have 4G and wifi issues with this phone too. Definitely want to swap this for the new G6 - last chance before I switch brands to a more reliable cheaper branded phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly nice, but no compass and GPS failed
customer_reviews.text: This Moto G5 was refurbished. The GPS failed in 3 out of 4 journeys but came back immediately when powered down and up. This makes it useless for Satnav, which is a major use for me, so I returned it. I also found it had no compass, which was disappointing and made walking-satnav less useful. The main camera was excellent, and the HDR feature produced some lovely photos in difficult conditions.
customer_reviews.author: pcq

customer_reviews.title: Three weeks use. Mainly positive. Initial issues. ...
customer_reviews.text: Three weeks use. Mainly positive. Initial issues. i) 'do not disturb' switches on automatically, awaiting response. ii) no magnetic sensor, therefore cannot use compass apps. iii) no facility to switch off auto sync for emails. iv) most apps cannot be moved to SD card even if it set as internal storage. Only 10GB of 16GB is available. v) not using fingerprint sensor to navigate as angle of movement must be exact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Moto 5 phone is a good choice for teenagers
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone for my daughter. She loves it as its "gold" and has 3gb of ram so she can play those mobile games. Brilliant camera and good reception. I hope she does not ask for an upgrade too soon.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. I. MacLeod

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget phone!
customer_reviews.text: A nice step up from my old Lumia 435, which was losing app availability due to Microsoft's apparent OS security issues. It does everything i want and some (apart from having a built in repeating text alert function (?), although I did find a suitable app to remedy this). An excellent phone for the money and it sports a decent sized screen too. Love t!
customer_reviews.author: Cappy

customer_reviews.title: Basic Android 7 Phone With Dual SIM Capabilities And 3Gb Of RAM
customer_reviews.text: My last LG G3 has a damaged screen and this budget model with 3Gb of ram seemed like a good choice. And yes, other than having to get a new SIM card as it takes Nano size setup was easy (only using it with one SIM card). Virtually no extras pre I stalled over basic Android ones, Android Version 7.0 and fingerprint unlock. Camera seems pretty good, fast in operation but miss a larger screen. Not a heavy phone user so I only have to charge it every two days.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nelson

customer_reviews.title: A little gem
customer_reviews.text: Had this phone for a few months now and I have to say I am very impressed. For a fraction of the cost of my iphone 7 it does most things at least as well and some things (4g reception being particularly notable) even better. And (taking into account the micro sd card I added) it has a lot more storage. What's not to like about that!!
customer_reviews.author: Brumbri

customer_reviews.title: If a certain Danish Brewery made phones.
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of reviews on you tube that have been done by professionals. All I can add is that if you want a tool rather than a status symbol then this is the phone for you. I have fitted a heavy duty case cover from Case collections. a Sparin Tempered glass screen protector and a set of bluetooth headphones from Taotronics and the whole package works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: shocking customer service
customer_reviews.text: i bought this phone eearlier ion the year the speaker intermittantly fails dont try to get anything repaired under warrnaty by lenovo as io speak im on hoild for 40 minutes to the service cetre, they demand money for fixes despite me sending proof of purhase they dont andswer the phone and i have an e mail trail as long as muy arm trying to get sense from customer support. They are shockingly bad dAVID
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great phone at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I was forced to buy a new phone as my previous [Windows] phone took a swan dive into the sink. I had never used an Android before but was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to set up. There are lots more apps available on Google Play and I'm sure I haven't explored all its' possibilities yet. It charges quickly and the battery lasts me about 5 days on ordinary usage. The camera is also good, try out the panoramic option for a good all round picture.
customer_reviews.author: A spoiled cat lives here

customer_reviews.title: Good value but I miss having a compass
customer_reviews.text: Very good value for money and I like that it is stock android. However I miss the compass I had on my G2. Google Maps is awkward to use without a compass (I like being able to orient the map to the surroundings if you are navigating while walking) and Google Sky does not work at all as I found out when trying to locate the moon during its eclipse last night.
customer_reviews.author: Womble

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone .
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter and she is very happy with it.When people are paying £800 plus for new mobiles I really don't understand why when Motorola sell phones like this for a quarter of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had the same phone previous from somewhere else but the speaker went on it and I wanted the same phone again. When I saw this one that I've purchased I thought it was a great price, I bought it in gold and it looks great, works fine and I have had no problems with it, brilliant phone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very weak headphone jack which is not possible to repair.
customer_reviews.text: The phone worked very well for just over a year, then the headphone jack stopped working on the right hand output. The jack is not a replaceable item and I had to find a replacement motherboard as the headphone jack was part of it and inseparable. The phone shop couldn't repair the phone so I had to repair it myself. The jack on the replacement motherboard has broken again, so it must be a weak point with these phones. This is bad as it is not a replaceable item. A good phone but only if you never use a headset with it.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Great specs for a low price
customer_reviews.text: Great specs for a low price, it is a no brainer. Either buy this or a top end Pixel 2 or iphone to take better pics. nothing in between matches this. Camera is better than it was on the G5 and G5 plus
customer_reviews.author: M. Charalambous

customer_reviews.title: I love my Moto G5!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. I wanted an upgrade to my Moto g which had limited memory and liked it so much I only wanted the same brand with a memory card option. I have no WiFi at home so use my phone for the internet. My phone is not an extension of my body but it is a crucial tool and this does everything I want and more. Motorola have great independent reviews and as with the Moto g, this model lives up to its write ups and is brilliant for the price.
customer_reviews.author: b roberts

customer_reviews.title: Now have a G6 and am happy with that
customer_reviews.text: Worked well as everything but a telephone - calls could be made or received only occasionally, usually straight after a phone restart. During Internet research to troubleshoot, I saw similar problems reported with G5s, but no solutions worked for my phone. Amazon techs also tried to sort the problem, but finally suggested I send the phone back for a refund. Highly frustrating experience, especially as the first G5 I ordered never arrived... Now have a G6 and am happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Martin

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant value for money
customer_reviews.text: Having owned a first generation Moto G, I had high hopes for this one and it has not disappointed me. It's fast and reliable. Far better than the Samsung J5 I owned before (I would never buy another Samsung). I love the fact that it will automatically adopt an additional micro SD and use as internal storage. So far I have had no problems using any of the apps that were regularly failing on the Samsung. Even my iPhone loving teen-ager admits he's almost impressed. That is high praise for an android!
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, would recommend to most people happily
customer_reviews.text: Really solid phone for the price, good performance all round and a much better camera than budget phones from a couple of years back. Slowly catching up with some of the flagship phones' innovations... Battery life isn't bad by the standards today. Unlike my old Moto G3, it's got a removable battery (which never does any harm). Probably more than enough phone for a lot of people.
customer_reviews.author: JGV

customer_reviews.title: great phone, as per other comments
customer_reviews.text: great phone, as per other comments, its well made and well spec'd. in hindsight I'd probably have been better getting the g5s rather than the g5s+ as I don't need the extra processor as much as I thought and it is noticeably larger. having said that the phone will likely slow down over time so the extra processor power does add some future proofing and i'll get used to it
customer_reviews.author: ib

customer_reviews.title: This phone is an excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have no real criticism of this phone. It does everything I want it to and more. It is easy to set up and operate. The camera is excellent and even better with some photo apps to enhance your pictures. There is plenty of storage space and security features are easy to set up. The only slight downside is that the battery is not the best around. It seems to need recharging quite frequently even with modest usage.
customer_reviews.author: Queenie

customer_reviews.title: It's ok..!
customer_reviews.text: It's probably a bi late in the day to be reviewing this phone. Works well for most things but can't "cast" ? There are a couple of other things it can't do for some reason but I can't remember them at the moment. It's robust enough. Screen quality pretty decent. I'd think it's good value for money
customer_reviews.author: Krista Schug-Ringland

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: These phones are brilliant. I've had the first and second generation Moto G and now onto the G5, unbelievable value for money, really reliable, last for ages. With this model I find the photos slightly cool in tone, not a huge problem as that sort of thing can easily be corrected with photo editing software or filters.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a phone that would let me access the internet and use a few key apps. But I didn't want to spend a fortune. The Moto G5 was the stand out 'budget' phone in the reviews I read. I have not been disappointed. Really nice phone. Decent camera. Plenty fast enough for my needs. I can't think what more I would get out of a high end phone three or four times the price.
customer_reviews.author: ynotrunfast

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for a weekend smart phone and all the articles i read said this ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a weekend smart phone and all the articles i read said this was the best budget phone. Good camera and battery and does everything needed in a phone. Why did i ever pay more?!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Good value smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Good value smartphone, needs more memory (and any microsd card memory upgrade needs to be the fastest available (4K speed) to get the required performance). Good camera although basic. Fingerprint log on is very useful and the Android interface is standard so pretty good. Light and rugged with clear screen and reasonable battery life.
customer_reviews.author: robinf

customer_reviews.title: Ideal budget phone
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the best phone I've ever had. No bugs or glitches to report and I've had it almost a year now. I wanted something decent, not too big, and not too expensive. This came up top of the leaderboard on all accounts. It's functional, attractive, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Darklas

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful
customer_reviews.text: For some inexplicable reason, and customer help were unable to help, teXT cannot be sent because of an "error 96" and the phone vibrates randomly. In neither case can the problem be solved except by, with no guarantee that it will work, a 'factory reset' or some other convoluted procedure. I have googled the problem and I know that I am not alone.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Good budget phone died too soon
customer_reviews.text: Used it for about 2 yrs and the phone just died! One minute it was 85% charged, next minute its dead and not responding anymore. Otherwise good budget phone, fast with lots of features. Should be good for kids as games are running fast. Cons: - no screen mirroring - speaker is a cr*p as not loud enough and quality is poor - storage too little, cannot move bigger apps to SD card
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: Broken in a month sent back got a refund - would not buy again- see internet about problems with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone to buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone. I definitely recommend this than other expensive mobiles. It does the work. Problem with FB app which closes with error. Otherwise it is all good.
customer_reviews.author: AK24

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value for money
customer_reviews.text: Awesome value for money, provides everything I need in a mobile at a quarter of the price of more established mobiles. The only thing that disappoints is the camera which is still a bit lacking compared to more expensive mobiles.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Very good value phone with dual SIM
customer_reviews.text: My first smart phone so didn't want anything too expensive. Very pleased as it is simple to use and very light. An excellent entry level phone. I also bought a cover as I did drop the phone and wanted extra protection.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: within first minutes of opening the phone the screen of ...
customer_reviews.text: within first minutes of opening the phone the screen of phone was not responding correctly to my finger touch,msgs received not being shown in time and other notifications being held from my sight unless i unlock the phone screen.waiting for refund from amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dual sim problems
customer_reviews.text: Dual sim doesn't seem to work too well. If I have one O2 sim in, I get very good 4G, but when I put another sim in the O2 data signal seems to degrade often falling back to Edge/2G. Other than that, it's a good phone. At least where I live it's not really useful as a dual sim phone, however.
customer_reviews.author: Richard276371

customer_reviews.title: it's a great stock android for a great price
customer_reviews.text: as other reviewers have pointed out, it's a great stock android for a great price... i can only fault one thing, the screen cracked from the edge of the earpiece cut out to half way down the side from hardly any pressure, the glass flexed from new when pressing on the middle, i'm not talking bend tests here, your little finger can flex the glass!, literally the only thing wrong with the device, its a hollow screen!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I had the Moto G3 for 4 years, but the battery was failing (not readily replaceable), but this is an awesome upgrade, faster, more storage, better display and cameras front and rear and it's Android 8!
customer_reviews.author: ex15

customer_reviews.title: Best phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best phone for the money. Stock android far more intuitive than some other mucked about with versions such as with Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget Smart Phone Yet
customer_reviews.text: Best budget phone I've ever bought. Has everything you could need and is super fast. Gyroscope and location are really high quality, great for fitness tracking. Microphone and speaker are also high quality. Battery life is excellent even though I have a million apps running at once. First phone I've had where snapchat and insta stories don't lag behind also. Totally worth the money... Built-in night display helps your sleep too!
customer_reviews.author: punchtalks

customer_reviews.title: Amazing service, prompt delivery and perfect product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing service, prompt delivery and perfect product. I bought two, one for my Mum and one for me, the phone is incredibly easy for her to use. It has a great camera, battery life and resolution.
customer_reviews.author: MollykinsWoo

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Phones these days are way OTT and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Phones these days are way OTT and that goes for price too. This is in the real world, more than adequate for what phones are for these days. Fast internet browsing and streaming, more than enough processing power to cope with multiple applications. Good battery and fast charging. I love the easy access functions, such as physically twisting the phone to instantly open camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gab

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Thought about getting a larger screen and 3 gb ram version but decided it was the ideal size to fit in my pockets along with all the other stuff we all carry nowadays.As for the ram the speed is quite good for my needs as I do not run multi apps and do my more important things on a PC or a laptop.It feels good to hold, the screen definition clear and the sound is adequate so very happy.It took a fair number of updates when I plugged it in so allow a good amount of time to complete depending on speed available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality phone at low cost
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected after 1 month ownership. Good combination of screen size and compactness so discretely carried in pocket. Fast and easy to use, brilliant display. Should last for years to come ... until next "must have" wizard tech comes along. This was upgrade for previous Moto g phone which has given me unfailing service for over 3 years but eventually ran out of (fixed) storage. Like the professional reviewers say, it's a great phone for relatively little money.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for Amazons return policy its not what we expect in the UK.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone 4 months ago from Amazon Warehouse as a spare office phone so didn't use it in anger until this month and the radio doesn't work properly. It drops signal or doesn't pick one up at all. The returns policy is 30 days so its £100 down the bin.
customer_reviews.author: superchels

customer_reviews.title: Great screen and a great camera for this price range
customer_reviews.text: Once again Motorola hit another home run with the latest in the G series. Great screen and a great camera for this price range, 16GB of storage is plenty for me to download films and tunes for my daily commute! I'd say the Samsung J5 is the only phone in the price bracket that comes close...but not close enough! I'm a Happy Boy!
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Great value handset
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money and feels premium in the hand. Almost a stock android experience and battery life is stellar. Camera is fine for this price point but don't expect Samsung flagship quality images.
customer_reviews.author: Mr T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed. I got an extra memory card as the memory on the phone didn't get me very far, but even with that the overall cost was pretty low. Phone works well, fast enough, the camera wasn't great at first but a recent update has made it way better. It doesn't look or feel as cheap as it actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Kazazz

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Delighted with my new phone replacing the previous Motorola which had started to delete mails probably due to age. This one is great and not too big for my handbag which was a concern before purchase. Very nice machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Smith

customer_reviews.title: Died just before the 2 year mark
customer_reviews.text: It would be a good phone, but it's clearly very poorly made as everything is failing after 18 months; won't always boot, camera is dead, battery won't last the night on standby, memory is failing etc.
customer_reviews.author: TBow88

customer_reviews.title: Better than the budget price tag.
customer_reviews.text: First class phone however, updates, especially to Oreo seem to take an age to come through. I am very happy with the quality, speed and overall reliability. I used to buy the big brand phones "Samsung" with unfortunately the bigger price tag. Does everything just as well for considerably less.
customer_reviews.author: Technochick2000

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the  money
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the money, couple of niggly things that I don't like compared with my previous moto G (no flashing light to show a text, no photo gallery), but overall an improvement, just because of the extra space and speed.
customer_reviews.author: mjrusty5

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations except...
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the weight, the size, quality image is ok (but I expected a bit more), capacity and memory is good for me (I don't use many apps though). Very disappointed it doesn't support Catalan language so I can't have it in my language and the keyboard is a nightmare because it changes everything I write into English or Spanish (the other tow languages I speak and use).
customer_reviews.author: Estela Bayarri

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: This is my second handset of this model. The first failed very quickly and was replaced. The sound output is very poor and i struggle to hear. Battery life is dreadful, don't expect it to last a day with proper use. The microphone is terrible, resulting in the person on the other end questioning if you're still on the line. The phone gets very hot when in use. Don't bother watching videos because the speaker is just not loud enough for anyone who isn't an owl. Previous models were half decent but this is just trash,do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a good phone. I wish I had bought the next ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good phone. I wish I had bought the next step up with NFC. I'd encourage the larger drive and that feature. The camera is solid and this is easily the best phone for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected, but not perfect. Back of the phone is slippery metal, the front of the phone is smooth glass. The phone does not balance properly in the hand, it is slightly top heavy with the centre of gravity horizontally around the power button, feels strange in the hand and when you take one handed landscape photos.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: It's a good phone apart from that but after a few months ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone after having returned the Moto G4 Plus as it constantly dropped mobile connection and wouldn't reconnect without a restart. Unfortunately the exact same issue occurs with this model and it appears it's a known issue. It's a good phone apart from that but after a few months I was having to restart the phone around three times a day and couldn't put up with it any more. A real shame as it's a great value phone with a brilliant camera and really good performance. I won't be buying another Moto though.
customer_reviews.author: Niall Maher

customer_reviews.title: Best budget phone so far
customer_reviews.text: Fourth Motorola in a row... Best budget phone so far! Seems to be same quality even with Lenovo takeover. Only downer: I haven't found a suitable protection cover yet...
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love this to bits. Bought on the back of a Which? Best Buy recommendation and really pleased with it so far. Uploads and updates are completed really quickly and it has lots of great features which you wouldn't perhaps expect on such a reasonably priced phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as its predecssors.
customer_reviews.text: Only 2G capability on second sim (not mentioned on web page) - not very useful if you want to use three as the second sim! Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not inspired
customer_reviews.text: Keep hanging. Once it freezes it will not be functional untill switched off/on
customer_reviews.author: Emzee

customer_reviews.title: Constantly restarting
customer_reviews.text: Within a short period after purchase phone started restarting sent off via Amazon to repairer called Fonfix and nearly a month later after two emails to amazon still don't know whats happening with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: G. Roebuck

customer_reviews.title: Died on me a month after purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Hated the experience of using this, it was painful and ugly! The battery died on me a month after purchase - may have been an anomaly but it put me off wanting another. Had a Huawei for a while now and just went back to them and am so happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad Zain Ali

customer_reviews.title: ... of things you hardly ever use you won't get better at the
customer_reviews.text: Lovely phone does every thing you need in a phone metal body feels quality rarther than a phone that does loads of things you hardly ever use you won't get better at the price
customer_reviews.author: Leslie wells

customer_reviews.title: Good phone but overheat when watching videos etc eventually packed ...
customer_reviews.text: Good phone but overheat when watching videos etc eventually packed up and went dead could not get it going after looking on internet and trying all remedies reluctant to put in for repair as bank info etc on it lasted 18 months so not bad for money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: I love this Phone, slim, big screen and easy to use. Performing very well so far. Value for money
customer_reviews.author: Mary Murphy

customer_reviews.title: like this phone - a bit bigger than previous one ...
customer_reviews.text: like this phone - a bit bigger than previous one I had of theirs, but good battery life, better camera than before and decent performance + all for a very decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Jon A. Crowcroft

customer_reviews.title: I am really pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: My previous phone was a Moto X Style, which had started to need charging twice per day, and was becoming slow to respond to screen taps. The Moto 5GS Plus is so much quicker, and I only need to charge it every 2 or 3 days for the way I use my phone. I am really pleased with it, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Goodiwn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible audio quality
customer_reviews.text: I only had this phone for around a month, before my friends started to complain that my voice was really muffled on calls. Recently, my voice has been totally muted and I can only actually make a call via speaker. I've tested my microphone and speakers which are totally fine. It seems to be a recurring problem with the G5, but its pretty poor that a smartphone can't run the most basic function of a phone. Generally, the lack of support from Moto/Lenovo means that I don't think I'll purchase another model from them in the future, and I just want to get rid of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Brisbourne

customer_reviews.title: Great value device
customer_reviews.text: This device is built well featuring a metal design, and the quality of the screen is great. Using this device is a great experience, it performs well and provides a near stock Android experience. The only slight downside is the lack of USB-C, but it still charges fairly fast through Micro USB due to fast charge technology.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the best purchase I have made on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to my roomate to whom i listen and who has the same phone but older version of it, I bought it two months ago and i'm very pleased of it. Cheap, durable and at the same time offers the same pampering as the expensive phones you can see on the market nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: gabriella

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is a totally brilliant smartphone. great display and camera more than enough ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a totally brilliant smartphone. great display and camera more than enough for most users.
customer_reviews.author: IanD

customer_reviews.title: Luv,luv ,luv this phone
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about my new phone ,just wish l had bought one sooner ... Still learning , but l find the fingerprint a god send .
customer_reviews.author: ladymc

customer_reviews.title: I like it but please bring back the gyroscope!
customer_reviews.text: All in all a very good phone. The only thing missing is a the gyroscope, so if you try to use the GPS and you are on foot, meaning you are moving in a relatively slow speed, you get confused because it won't show which direction you face.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Petriti

product_meta.title: Motorola Moto G5 16GB with 3 GB RAM (Dual Sim) UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Fine Gold
product_meta.description:
Size Name:3GB RAM| Style Name:G5| Colour Name:Fine GoldThe Lenovo Moto G5 Exclusive model has been designed specifically for Amazon customers on the basis of customer reviews and feedback. This model includes extended RAM of 3GB for faster processing power and Dual SIM card slots to use 2 Sim Cards in just the one device. Charge the device to over 80% capacity in just 30-40 minutes (with a Turbo Charger) and snap away with an amazing 13MP camera. Finger Print Sensor for added security 3GB or RAM for faster processing, and 16GB of Storage. MicroSD slot to expand up to 128GB. Dual Sim Card slots to use 2 Sim Cards in just the one device, ideal for travelling or work. 13MP Front Facing and 3MP Rear Camera, for selfies and stunningly clear photos. LTE (4G/3G), Bluetooth and WiFi Enabled. Dolby Digital 5.1 sound output with DTS Technology. 2800 Li-Ion Battery, Micro USB, 3.5mm Audio Jack, LED for Low Battery. Accelerometer, Proximity Sensor and Gyroscope.

BOX CONTAINS
Motorola Moto G5 3GB RAM/16GB Storage - Fine Gold
feature_bullets: Amazon Exclusive Model; 3GB RAM with Dual SIM
1.4GHz Octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 Processor with 16GB of Internal Storage
Android Nougat (V7.0) and supports Rapid Charging (80% charge in just 30-40 minutes) 10W Charger included
13 Mega Pixel Rear Camera, f/2.0, auto focus, Dual-LED Flash, Auto HDR with 1080p 30fps Video. 5 Mega Pixel Front Camera, f/2.2, auto HDR
5.0 inch screen with 1080x1920 pixels (401ppi), 2800 Li-Ion Removable Battery
External Memory Card Slot (MicroSD up to 128GB) and Fingerprint Sensor

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
